snippet.title: Mazezam Challenge (SNES) - Gameplay
snippet.description:
Get actual SNES cartridge at: https://www.pikointeractive.com/store.html#!/Mazezam-Challenge-SNES/p/50560311/category=14008401

Mazezam Challenge is a Puzzle Video game, originally developed by Malcom Tyrrell for ZX Spectrum home computer in 2002. In 2012 it has been ported by Alek Maul to the SNES. This version became the winner of the Neo Flash 2012 video game competition, and was featured in a Retro Video Game Magazine from the UK.

The gameplay can be described as a cross between Sokoban and Traffic Jam. The main goal of the game is help the character pass through different stages that are filled with obstacles. The player has to be very careful while moving the obstacles to not close down his path, because if he does, he would need to restart the stage with the cost of a life.

• Over 50 levels of increasing difficulty
• Password system
• Multilingual, contains both French and English text
• 16-bit graphics and sound
